lines.text: And don't forget, if you want your appendix out, or your tonsils trimmed, I'm your man, when I've qualified.
By the time I've had one year or two at hospital, what I know about surgery will fill a book!
Yes, and what you don't know will fill a cemetery!
Hmm, not so hot having the boss's nephew looking over your shoulder all the time, though.
No. I don't quite know what to do about it. He may share his uncle's old-fashioned ideas as to how accounts should be kept.
I'm afraid he might not understand my methods.
You mean you're afraid he might!
I wouldn't work for Bradbury again for 100 a week, the ruddy hypocrite!
Maybe you've got him all wrong. Maybe he's just a disciplinarian.
He can be a vegetarian for all I care!
